metadata.title: CVE-2024-42311 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:hfs: fix to initialize fields of hfs_inode_info after hfs_alloc_inode()Syzbot reports uninitialized value access issue as     Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-42311` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-200-generic - 5.4.0-200.220~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-200-lowlatency - 5.4.0-200.220~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1139-gcp - 5.4.0-1139.148~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1082-ibm - 5.4.0-1082.87~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
